ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Over the past week, did the following skills help you to deal more effectively with your problems: Identifying triggers for alcohol - noticing signs of craving alcohol such as physical sensations, emotions, and thoughts
Notes: 0=I didn't try to use the skill; 1=No, it seemed to make things worse; 2=No, it didn't really help; 3=It helped; 4=It helped a great deal; -8=Prefer not to respond

ElementDescription: Over the past week, did the following skills help you to deal more effectively with your problems: Removing triggers for alcohol - getting rid of things that make it likely you will drink, such as alcohol in your home and not going to high-risk situations such as bars
Notes: 0=I didn't try to use the skill; 1=No, it seemed to make things worse; 2=No, it didn't really help; 3=It helped; 4=It helped a great deal; -8=Prefer not to respond

ElementDescription: Over the past week, did the following skills help you to deal more effectively with your problems: Harm reductions - making healthier decisions when drinking such as counting drinks, drinking water in-between alcoholic drinks, and having a designated driver
Notes: 0=I didn't try to use the skill; 1=No, it seemed to make things worse; 2=No, it didn't really help; 3=It helped; 4=It helped a great deal; -7=This skill does not apply to me; -8=Prefer not to respond
